TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ServiceDescription extends System.Web.Services.Description.NamedItem

Docs.summary: Provides a means of creating and formatting a valid Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document file, complete with appropriate namespaces, elements, and attributes, for describing an XML Web service. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of this class can be created with either the `new` keyword or the static <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription.Read%2A> method, which parses a WSDL file and assigns its values to appropriate members of the class.
WSDL is an XML-based language for describing XML Web services. The ServiceDescription class corresponds to the root element, `definitions`, of a WSDL file. For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples The following example shows how to create an instance of the ServiceDescription class.
[!code-vb[ServiceDescription#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_0_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ServiceDescription#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[ServiceDescription#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_0_1.cs)]

Gets or sets the URL of the XML Web service to which the instance applies.
Docs.value: The URL of the XML Web service. The default value is an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets the schema associated with this .
Gets the XML serializer used to serialize and deserialize between a object and a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.
Docs.value: The XML serializer used to serialize and deserialize between a object and a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The XML serializer can be customized using classes derived from the abstract <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionFormatExtension> class. These classes are specified in a configuration file using the `serviceDescriptionFormatExtensionTypes` element and its child `add` element. The configuration can be applied to an ASP.NET Web application that publishes a Web service.
